summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence primarily between attorneys Allison Stoddart and an Assistant United States Attorney, with copies to Anjan Sahni, regarding scheduling meetings and discussions about identifying a trial witness from JPMorgan for the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails focus on logistical coordination for the defense and prosecution teams during the pre-trial and jury selection phase.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or involved in the defense for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating meeting times and witness discussions with the prosecution.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, copied on emails regarding scheduling and trial witness matters.

persons.name: Pat
persons.context: Individual referenced by Allison Stoddart as someone with whom meetings are being scheduled; likely a colleague or client associated with the defense team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the email correspondence.

connections.description: Defense attorney and prosecutor communicating about scheduling and trial preparation for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Stoddart is scheduling meetings involving Pat, indicating a working relationship, likely within the same legal team.
Stoddart is an attorney from WilmerHale involved in the Maxwell case, indicating representation or legal support.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Pat
events.description: Allison Stoddart confirms a meeting for Monday at 6pm, proposing to use Zoom to avoid Webex issues.

events.title: Evening Call with Pat
events.description: Stoddart checks if an evening call with Pat is still possible, noting his availability from 6-9pm.

events.title: Follow-up on Scheduling
events.description: An email follows up on scheduling a meeting, noting Pat's travel and proposing evening/weekend times due to jury selection.

events.title: Request for Trial Subpoena to JPMorgan
events.description: Allison Stoddart requests a trial appearance subpoena for a witness from JPMorgan, and the AUSA attaches a draft subpoena.

events.title: Prosecution Sends Draft Exhibits
events.description: The Assistant United States Attorney sends draft exhibits to facilitate discussion about identifying a JPMorgan witness for trial.

keyFacts: The defense team, represented by Allison Stoddart of WilmerHale, is coordinating with the prosecution to identify a trial witness from JPMorgan.
A trial appearance subpoena was requested by the defense and provided by the prosecution to JPMorgan regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Email correspondence highlights the logistical challenges of scheduling meetings during the jury selection phase of the trial in November 2021.
The prosecution sent draft exhibits to the defense to aid in discussions about the JPMorgan witness.
Communication shows professional coordination between adversarial legal teams on procedural matters.
